name: Beginner Chest & Arms Routine
description: A basic routine suitable for beginners to start strengthening the chest and arms muscles.

exercises.name: Push-ups
exercises.description: Keep your feet together and your hands shoulder-width apart, lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor. Push yourself back to the starting position.

exercises.name: Bicep Curls with Resistance Bands
exercises.description: Stand on a resistance band. Hold one end in each hand, arms fully extended, palms facing forward. Curl your hands towards your shoulders, maintaining the position of your elbows. Slowly lower your hands back to the starting position.

exercises.name: Chair Dips
exercises.description: Position your hands shoulder-width apart on a secured bench or stable chair. Move your bottom off the front of the bench with your legs extended out in front of you. Lower your body until your shoulders are below your elbows. Push back up until your elbows are nearly straight but not locked.

name: Intermediate Chest & Arms Routine
description: A slightly more challenging routine suitable for users with moderate fitness levels.

exercises.name: Incline Push-ups
exercises.description: Find a stable surface above the ground like a bench. Place hands on the edge of the bench, walk your feet out and perform a push-up in this inclined position.

exercises.name: Diamond Push-ups
exercises.description: Come into the top of a push-up position and place your hands close together so your thumbs and index fingers touch. Keeping your body straight and rigid, bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the floor, then press back up.

exercises.name: Tricep Dips
exercises.description: Position your hands shoulder-width apart on a secured bench or stable chair. Slide your butt off the front of the bench with your legs extended out in front of you. Lower your body until your shoulders are below your elbows. Push back up until your elbows are nearly straight but not locked.

name: Advanced Chest & Arms Routine
description: A high-intensity routine for advanced users to really challenge their chest and arm muscles.

exercises.name: One Arm Push-ups
exercises.description: Perform a push-up with only one hand on the ground, the other on your back.

exercises.name: Archer Push-ups
exercises.description: Perform a push-up with one arm extended out to the side. As you lower yourself, keep one arm straight (like an archer pulling back their bow) while the other arm bends as in a regular push-up.

exercises.name: Pike Push-ups
exercises.description: Start in a downward dog position with your hands and feet on the floor and your hips raised. Lower your upper body towards the floor while keeping your legs straight, then push yourself back up.
